com.drs.gem.injector.core

Interface Container


  • public interface Container

    Interface represents Dependency Injection container. Container instance is used to declare new modules, initialize, inject dependencies into all modules declared via this container instance and obtaining fully initialized module instances.

    Modules in container can be declared in two ways:

    • using .declareModule() method to provide module descriptions;
    • using Declaration interface during container creation in GemInjector.buildContainer(). It provides one abstract method getDeclaredModules() that returns Set of GemModuleDeclaration objects each of which describes its own module.

    Important note.
    You are not allowed to mix declaration types in one container. If you have chosen to use .declareModule() you can not specify Declaration for the same container. And vise versa, if you have specified appropriate Declaration for this container it is not permitted to use .declareModule() with it.

    Important note â„–2.
    You can declare modules with Declaration or with .declareModule() but you are not allowed to introduce new modules after init() method has been invoked.

    Author:
    Diarsid

    • Method Detail

      • declareModule

        void declareModule(String moduleInterface,
                   String moduleImplem,
                   GemModuleType type)
        Method to declare new module in container.
        Parameters:
        moduleInterface - canonical name of declared module interface.
        moduleImplem - canonical name of declared module implementation class.
        type - module's type, SINGLETON or PROTOTYPE.
        See Also:
        GemModuleType

      • init

        void init()
        Start point of container's work.
        Container collects all information about modules and initializes all singleton modules declared in this container instance.

      • useRecursiveInjector

        void useRecursiveInjector()

        There are two different possible dependency collection and injection algorithms. One of them uses method recursion, other uses a lot of loop with a number of if-else branching.

        Default algorithm is one that uses loops and if-else conditions. This method forces container to use recursive algorithm.

        It is not recommended to use recursive one. It was retained only due to historical reasons.

      • getModule

        <M extends GemModule> M getModule(Class<M> moduleClass)
        Returns fully initialized instance of specified module.
        Type Parameters:
        M - actual module interface.
        Parameters:
        moduleClass - class object of actual module interface.
        Returns:
        fully initialized module.
        See Also:
        GemModule
